corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: Evelyn Wiener (1914-2005) was a Communist Party USA activist, and in the 1940s was its Manhattan District Organizer. After leaving the Party in the 1960s, she remained a progressive activist, especially in peace movements, and a community organizer in the Lower East Side neighborhood of New York City. The bulk of the material appears to be from the 1960s through the 1980s. The seventeen files that comprise the collection include folders on the Lower Eastside Mobilization for Peace Action, Mobilization for Survival, National Alliance Against Racism and Political Repression, Indochina Solidarity Committee, Benjamin Davis, folders on Chile, Puerto Rico, Thailand and Vietnam, and a file of obituaries.

p.value: Donated in 2005; donor unknown. The accession number associated with this gift is 2005.026.

<emph render="italic">Remembering Evelyn Wiener </emph> by Eleanor Stein
http://mrzine.monthlyreview.org/2005/steinwiener271005.html

The bulk of the material appears to be from the 1960s through the 1980s. The seventeen files that comprise the collection include folders on the Lower Eastside Mobilization for Peace Action, Mobilization for Survival, National Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression, Indochina Solidarity Committee, Benjamin Davis, folders on Chile, Puerto Rico, Thailand and Vietnam, and a file of obituaries.
